title: I'm not as good as Riot thinks I am, and I need help because of it
body:
I am constantly matched into normals with players who are vastly better than me.

It feels like every game I get matched with people who have Plat/Diamond borders, and it's infuriating.

I can't play normals to practice, because the players I'm up against are so much better than I am that it's ruining my experience. I don't want to play ranked without practicing, because it will ruin it for the people on my team there as well.
I don't want to try to drop my normals MMR by feeding, because I don't want to ruin other people's games in the hope that I can improve mine.

I have a massive normals lead of around 160 wins, due to picking up the game fast when i first started playing, and I don't know if that's still somehow affecting how I'm matched with people.

I hate being a hindrance by being so awful compared to my team, and so easy to stomp for my enemy.

It doesn't help that it almost always means that I get flamed for being bad, when I'm trying my best but it's simply not good enough.

Is there ANY way I can fix this? It's a real problem and it makes league much more difficult and frustrating than it should be.

rip

Unfortunately there isn't much to do in norms to fix this, at least not quickly.
 If you continue to play, it will *eventually* even out, but that could take a while. 
You can always try sending a support ticket in to Riot but it is unlikely to change anything. 

The best you can do in this situation is to get a solid list of friends to 5man with, knowing they wont flame you. It will provide a more supportive environment to learn and try new things, as well as having the added bonus of slightly higher IP and mastery gains as you go. For this you can always try the [team recruitment board](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/team-recruitment),[ clubs](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/clubs) (or university/high school groups if that's where you're at), or even facebook groups like [Summoners Society](https://www.facebook.com/groups/SummonersSocietyOCE/). 

It is pretty frustrating constantly being up against people that will destroy you in lane, but eventually you will rise to the challenge (even though that seems like it will never happen). In fact, one of the best learning strategies for a lot of things is to throw yourself into the deep end, getting completely wrecked until you start adapting to the situation. You will come out the other end better for it. 

GL HF ♥
